summary: This document is a chain of emails from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding travel approval and arrangements for prosecutors and staff to conduct witness interviews in connection with the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). It details multiple trips from 2019 to 2020 to locations including Pensacola, Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, and Stockholm, Sweden.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: SDNY legal assistant handling travel reservations and logistics for the prosecution team's trips related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: SDNY staff member copied on travel approval emails, providing information about booking charges.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: SDNY prosecutor requesting travel approval and making flight arrangements for witness interviews in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: SDNY official (likely a supervisor) who approves travel requests for the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: SDNY staff member copied on travel approval emails.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: SDNY prosecutor traveling with Maurene and/or Alex for witness interviews in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Lead SDNY prosecutor (likely Alexander R. A. or similar) submitting multiple travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation team to interview witnesses.

connections.description: Alex submits travel approval requests to Edward Tyrrell, who approves them, indicating a supervisor-subordinate relationship within the SDNY.
Prosecutors traveling together as a team to conduct witness interviews for the Epstein investigation.
Both are prosecutors on the Epstein case team, with Alex often requesting travel for himself, Maurene, and Alison.
Darlene, as a legal assistant, handles flight and hotel bookings for Maurene's travel related to the investigation.
Prosecutors working together on the Epstein case, with Alex requesting travel for both of them to interview victims.

events.description: SDNY prosecutors Maurene and Alison travel to Pensacola, Florida to interview a witness in the Epstein investigation.

events.description: Prosecutors Alex and Alison request travel to West Palm Beach for meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

keyFacts: The document reveals active witness and victim interviews conducted by the SDNY in the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618) from at least March 2019 through February 2020.
The investigation had an international component, with a planned witness interview near Stockholm, Sweden in January 2020.
Multiple trips were made to Florida (Pensacola, West Palm Beach) and California (Los Angeles), indicating witnesses or evidence located in those areas.
The prosecution team frequently requested and used hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews, suggesting formal, recorded proceedings.
Travel was approved through a formal chain of command within the SDNY, with Edward Tyrrell as the approving official for these investigative trips.
